artist: Designer: Charles A. Bailey; Manufacturer: J. & E. Stevens Company, Cromwell, Connecticut, 1843–1950s
description: rectangular lower portion with floral designs, lion's head on PL side and little boy and birds on front; top section has soldier standing next to a paper guide indicating money deposited; girl in long dress with pointer, accompanied by a dog, indicates amount
markings: on bottom, on sticker: [4-5-9 / \"Perfection 208 Registering Bank\" / \'82 3600 80 3000 / M190 4500 / A.D. Mosler]
title: "Perfection Registering Bank" mechanical bank
